alert.note: Alert for Ford; Iroquois; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 6:38AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and east central Illinois, including the following areas, in central Illinois, Livingston. In east central Illinois, Ford and Iroquois. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Slow moving or standing water may occur in flat areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 AM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. This rainfall is occurring over the same locations that experienced 3 to 6 inches of rain on Saturday. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pontiac, Fairbury, Gilman, Milford, Chatsworth, Onarga, Forrest, Cissna Park, Piper City, Buckley, Cullom, Saunemin, Crescent City, Danforth, Roberts, Woodland, Wellington, Thawville and Claytonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
